result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alondra A Clark

records.addlTxt: 2:56 PM Defendant Alondra A Clark in court.  Attorney Frank J. Remington in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes SPD has approved DE for counsel but has yet to appoint counsel. DE waives time limits. Court sets status conference for 11-15-22 at 8:30am.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
SPD Appointment of Counsel Report:  Defn is Eligible for SPD services.  Atty not appointed yet.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Officer D Hernke except only for professional purposes. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 5

2:19 PM Defendant Alondra A Clark in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul M Fredrickson in court for Alondra A Clark.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Olsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
